intro: Satyria grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered satyria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Satyria grandifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
